Headline: Global Beauty Compliance Leader | Co-Founder, CRFT¬Æ & GCRS Group | Building the World‚Äôs Smartest AI Compliance Platform | Enabling Market Access in 50+ Countries | 20+ Years | Shaping the Future of Beauty Safety
Comment:
Rishabh Mariwala When I work on any M&A projects, one of the first questions I ask my team is: how strong is the compliance foundation of this brand or organisation?

In many markets, compliance is the very path to launch and validation. In others, it becomes the defining factor once the initial buzz fades and the real test of growth begins.

Too often, brands celebrate traction and early validation, only to face compliance issues when they become an obstacle. The truth is, when compliance is built into the DNA of product development, brands can expand across global markets seamlessly without draining resources to patch gaps later.

In the beauty industry especially, sustainable and global growth requires more than hype and habits. It calls for foresight, discipline and the willingness to walk the extra mile during development, rather than waiting to react ‚Äúwhen the time comes.‚Äù

Compliance may not be glamorous, but it is the invisible force that separates brands that fade after the buzz from those that scale globally with resilience and credibility.
processed_comment: rishabh mariwala when i work on any ma projects one of the first questions i ask my team is how strong is the compliance foundation of this brand or organisation in many markets compliance is the very path to launch and validation in others it becomes the defining factor once the initial buzz fades and the real test of growth begins too often brands celebrate traction and early validation only to face compliance issues when they become an obstacle the truth is when compliance is built into the dna of product development brands can expand across global markets seamlessly without draining resources to patch gaps later in the beauty industry especially sustainable and global growth requires more than hype and habits it calls for foresight discipline and the willingness to walk the extra mile during development rather than waiting to react when the time comes compliance may not be glamorous but it is the invisible force that separates brands that fade after the buzz from those that scale globally with resilience and credibility

I have noticed regular spikes in stores where consumers, like me, visit weekly or biweekly. This is largely driven by attractive discounts, a wide variety of products, and competitive pricing. Such buying behavior resembles a mela, where the crowd itself attracts more crowd. In these settings, people not only enjoy the shopping experience but are also more likely to make impulsive purchases.
